it.polimi.ingsw.NetworkClient

Class SocketController

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.NetworkClient.SocketController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientHandlerInterface, java.rmi.Remote

    public class SocketController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientHandlerInterface
    Methods offered by the server, here implemented client side when performing a request

      • register

        public void register(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for registering
        Specified by:
        register in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        username - The new username for the account
        password - The new password associated to the new account
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in case there is another account already registered with the same username

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String clientname,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  Observer observer)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for logging in
        Specified by:
        login in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account
        password - The password associated to the account
        observer - The ObserverView object that represents the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in 2 different scenarios: the user il already logged in from another computer, the username or password provided are incorrect

      • logout

        public void logout(java.lang.String username,
                   Observer observer)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for logging out
        Specified by:
        logout in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the account from where we want to log out
        observer - The ObserverView object to be removed from the observers on the server (basically the client that wants to log out)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • createGame

        public void createGame(java.lang.String username,
                       Observer client,
                       java.lang.String gamename)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for creating a new game
        Specified by:
        createGame in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the account that wants to create a new game
        client - The Observer object that represents the client
        gamename - The name for the new match
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in 2 possible situations: the name for the new match is already taken, we are not able to find the user that performed the request in the UsersList on the server

      • joinaMatch

        public void joinaMatch(java.lang.String username,
                       Observer client,
                       java.lang.String gamename)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for joining a match
        Specified by:
        joinaMatch in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the account
        client - The Observer performing the request
        gamename - The name of the match we want to join
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in 2 possible situations: the match's name where we want to join is invalid, the username provided for the request is invalid

      • setSchemeCard

        public void setSchemeCard(java.lang.String username,
                          int cardid)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for setting the scheme card he had chosen
        Specified by:
        setSchemeCard in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the account performing the request
        cardid - The id associated to the chosen scheme card
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in 3 different situations: the provided username is not in the UsersList, the provided id is invalid, the player is not in a state where he can set a tool card

      • setDice

        public void setDice(java.lang.String clientname,
                    int diceindex,
                    int row,
                    int column)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for positioning a dice on a scheme card
        Specified by:
        setDice in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        diceindex - The index of the dice in the dicepool we want to put on the scheme card
        row - The row where we want to place the dice
        column - The column where we want to place the dice
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown for several reasons: the username is not in the UsersList, we are not able to retrieve the scheme card from the player, the diceIndex is an invalid one, we are not allowed to perform the action in the current state, we are not respecting a constrain of the specified position, the specified position is out from the scheme card

      • useaToolCard

        public void useaToolCard(java.lang.String clientname,
                         ToolRequestClass requestClass)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for using a tool card
        Specified by:
        useaToolCard in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        requestClass - A class with all the necessary parameters for performing the action (see the documentation for each tool card to see which parameters are required)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in different situations: something was wrong in performing the tool card action, wrong state in which to perform the action, the username is not in the UsersList

      • getToolCards

        public java.util.List getToolCards(java.lang.String clientname)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for receiving the tool cards extracted for the match
        Specified by:
        getToolCards in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Returns:
        A list of the available tool cards
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown when the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList on the server

      • getPossibleActions

        public java.util.List getPossibleActions(java.lang.String clientname)
                                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for getting the list of possible actions in the current state
        Specified by:
        getPossibleActions in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Returns:
        List of the possible actions
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown when the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList on the server

      • passTurn

        public void passTurn(java.lang.String clientname)
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for passing the turn
        Specified by:
        passTurn in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown when the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList on the server or when the action is not allowed in the current state

      • leavethematch

        public void leavethematch(java.lang.String clientname,
                          Observer observer)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for leaving the match he is in
        Specified by:
        leavethematch in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        observer - The Observer object that represents the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown when the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList on the server or when the action is not allowed in the current state

      • setToolCardDice

        public void setToolCardDice(java.lang.String clientname,
                            int row,
                            int column)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for setting the special dice connected to the particular tool card
        Specified by:
        setToolCardDice in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        row - The row where we want to put the dice
        column - The column where we want to put the dice
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in different situations: the specified username is not in the UsersList, the action performed is not allowed in the current state, the new position specified is out of the scheme card, there was some problem in getting the scheme card, the dice to be placed doesn't exist

      • getToken

        public int getToken(java.lang.String clientname)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for receiving how many segnalini does the player have
        Specified by:
        getToken in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Returns:
        The number of Segnalini Favore
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown when the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList on the server

      • setToolCardDiceIntensity

        public void setToolCardDiceIntensity(java.lang.String clientname,
                                     int intensity)
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for setting the intensity of the special dice in a particular tool card
        Specified by:
        setToolCardDiceIntensity in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        intensity - The intensity we want to set to the dice in a particular tool card
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in different situations: the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList, the action is not allowed in the current state, there is no dice set to which we can change the intensity

        public java.util.List getPlayersinmymatch(java.lang.String clientname)
                                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        Specified by:
        getPlayersinmymatch in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Returns:
        A list with al the other players in the match
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown when the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList on the server

      • getSchemeCardsoftheotherPlayers

        public java.util.List getSchemeCardsoftheotherPlayers(java.lang.String clientname)
                                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for receiving the maps of the other players
        Specified by:
        getSchemeCardsoftheotherPlayers in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Returns:
        A string with all the information about the maps of the other players
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in different situations: the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList, the scheme card associated to the player was not found, the action is not allowed in the current state

        public java.lang.String getToolCardDice(java.lang.String clientname)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is how the client invoke a request for getting the special dice extracted with the particular tool card
        Specified by:
        getToolCardDice in interface ClientHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientname - The username of the account performing the request
        Returns:
        A string with the information of the special dice for the particular tool card
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Exception thrown in different situations: the provided username doesn't exist in the UsersList, there is no special dice set at the moment
